website_summaries.verdict: This small and handy arm machine is simply used to build forearm strength.
pros: Use it while you're sitting on your couch or riding on a stationary bike
cons: Many users complain of not enough resistance, even on highest setting

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical but this is actually a great bit of equipment. I use it when I'm on the couch stroking one out. After one hand gets tired I'll swap out it gets a good workout while I'm doing what I do anyway. Can't go wrong. And I can definitely tell a difference in forearm definition almost immediately
customer_reviews.author: BOBDOLE

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: It really is a great product that is really smooth in transition in reps. My only knock on it is that it doesn't offer much in terms of resistance. They should've made it to go to a 10 instead of a 5 that way there's more room for growth.
customer_reviews.author: Victor

customer_reviews.title: It looks fancy and hi-tech but...
customer_reviews.text: This is great for beginners. But if you're an experienced weight trainer or just generally strong, then this may not be the product for you. The resistance level goes up to 5 which is very moderate in my opinion. There ought to be a level 10 for advanced. Unfortunately I'll be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Influential

customer_reviews.title: I like it for the most part
customer_reviews.text: I like it for the most part. It has different settings you can manually change yourself. Decently made material. However this device would be much better. If they added a padding layer to the part where your wrist will rest. It's very painful after a while using it. The hard plastic is rubbing and causing pressure on the back of the wrist. I've had to wear long sleeves with a wrist sweat band. For someone like me who's a girl with"girly" weak wrists. Trying to improve my wrists while harming them at the same time is counterproductive.
customer_reviews.author: EarthTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: It's the truth!
customer_reviews.text: My Husband cut his forearm, in 2011, which resulted in him losing some feeling in two fingers and a constant feeling of numbness and discomfort in his arm. Since then, he has been looking for ways to strengthen his forearm/grip and help with stretching the two fingers. Since he been using this product, he said he has experienced less discomfort and it really challenges/pushes him to use his arm more. This is exactly what he needed to feel some relief.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa M. Sulton

customer_reviews.title: Building forearm's like Popeye!
customer_reviews.text: Marcy's wrist and forearm developer works very well indeed. In about a month I've added over an ich to the size of my forearms and they are looking like bowling pins now. You can shift the developer so that it works more than one area,, I think it hit the inside upper area especially well. This is the second one of this I've owned over the years and I highly recommend it. It is well made and the tension adjuster works well. My only complaint is that my forearms are getting so big that they barely fit in the developer now!
customer_reviews.author: John Butz

customer_reviews.title: Popeye who?!?
customer_reviews.text: This is amazing my 17 year old loves it I have to but another one. He draws and plays Xbox so this will prevent future problems hopefully. I have carpal tunnel and very weak wrists. I lift weights but my hand strength is my biggest problem. Very study well constructed. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Alex M

customer_reviews.title: For women or 10 yr old boys
customer_reviews.text: The resistance is literally a joke if you're a grown man or work out regularly.
customer_reviews.author: Ruffus T. Murdock

customer_reviews.title: Cheap construction
customer_reviews.text: I used the same Marcy Wedge for over 30 years after I tore ligaments in my wrist. My original Wedge was steel construction with double tension wires. The Wedge is effective in treating wrist pain of several types including carpal tunnel. I'm sure the new device will be just as effective but due to the cheap materials and construction, I'll be happy if this Wedge last a couple years rather than over 30.
customer_reviews.author: larry wilson

customer_reviews.title: For beginners, or recovery from a injury.
customer_reviews.text: As wrist & forearm developer the device is not as I was expecting. The strength level of maximum was too easy. This device was not worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Myron

customer_reviews.title: Back from the dead.
customer_reviews.text: I had one of the originals back in the day and many many years later was sure i could not find another. Lo and behold they still make them. The construction has changed, it's not heavy duty plastic, it was metal way back when. It's still well built and can be adjusted to offer pretty great tension. This is not a replacement for grip training or other heavy duty forearm exercises. If you are advanced in those categories the highest setting might give you a little resistance. This is to isolate your forearms and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: LanFear

customer_reviews.title: This Is Worth the Money
customer_reviews.text: This is what everyone that is starting out or someone that has been working needs. It's adjustable enough to accommodate most all that will use it. You can start off easy and then adjust it as you progress, for the price you can not beat this tool, also I was impressed with the construction and the material it is constructed with, this bad-boy will work the crap out of your forearm. I'm 62 yrs old and have weight lifted for a long time ( when I was younger lol ) and this tool is a lot better ( and more wrist friendly ) than dumb-bells we used to use. I would for sur buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Just a Normal Person

customer_reviews.title: Misleading web info & customer info.
customer_reviews.text: I was so very disappointed in this product. Looking on the website it says it offers variable tension levels. I asked a question & was told that on the lowest level the tension is ridiculously low. Well, that may be true for athletes but is NOT true for those suffering from wrist injuries. I tried 1 time & that was enough to show that this item was NOT for me.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use, But Not Very Durable
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use with variable light to moderate resistance. The major drawback I’ve found is that the steel cable connecting the handle to the resistance unit will weaken over time and begin to fail. This is my second one and like the first, has only lasted a little less than two years (warranty period). Unfortunately, I will have to shop for a more durable alternative.
customer_reviews.author: William R

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: When I first got it and played with it a bit I thought, not going to be resistant enough. After an actual use today, I can see it will be good. Of course I'm doin it by time rather than count, so maybe I'm doing it wrong. I'm just starting to rebuild myself. I'm not looking to be hulk hoogan, just get back in shape. Setting 5 seems low, but trying to maintain a consistent pace for 5 min it did prove to become challenging. After a little while I might get where i want. With trial and error.
customer_reviews.author: DWarlord

customer_reviews.title: No resistance
customer_reviews.text: At it's max level, this barely offered any resistance. I would have to do upwards of 150 reps before I started to feel any kind of muscle strain. At that point.... I actually started developing some carpal-tunnel pain
customer_reviews.author: Nic P

customer_reviews.title: Provides good forearm workouts
customer_reviews.text: Sturdily constructed and easy to use, but does not provide as much resistance as anticipated for wrist curls. It still provides a good workout for the forearms. IIn the short time I've had and used it, it has firmed up and strengthened by forearms.
customer_reviews.author: Txagengr

customer_reviews.title: Solid construction, intuitive design, impressive tool, awesome value.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Highly recommend. The construction is very solid and has an intuitive design... Impressive at first glance and confirmed with use. The way to use this is passively throughout your day... High repetitions in a controlled fashion. The "Bruce Lee" approach. A fantastic purchase if you're wanting to develop wrists and forearm strength, definition and size. Also GREAT if you have an injury and your kineseotherapist recommends this type of motion. You won't injure yourself using this and it isn't for powerlifters but people looking to build a more functional strength and wellness but even a powerlifter will gain benefit. It is a solid value.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Sebo

customer_reviews.title: Effective and cheap
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. Very simple to adjust the spring/wire tension and once you use it, you can really feel the intensity on your forearms. I wish there was some padding on the rest which pushes against your forearm as it is hard plastic. Some people may have to move the device further down or up just so they feel comfortable. But not a deal breaker at the price! Overall very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Rakesh

customer_reviews.title: This is an EXCEPTIONAL VALUE!
customer_reviews.text: This is the greatest answer to my wife's forearms problems; she had broken both wrists at two separate events in the last 10 years. Although she was active in physical rehab once she was finished with such we went about life's business, however she was showing atrophy of her forarms and wrists. The physical therapists had utilized devices that worked the same way. This device is easy to use at home especially to one's own schedule. We are already seeing positive results. Best of all, it arrived less than a week after I ordered it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This thing works great!
customer_reviews.text: Was very skeptical about this device but it really works. One of the best forearm workouts I've ever gotten. It's light but really sturdy. Beats lugging dumbbells around or kettle balls but yet does the same thing. I just leave it on my desk and bust out a forearm workout whenever I want. Who knows what Popeye would have looked like with one of these. All I can say is what's taking so long to come out with one for the upper arm?
customer_reviews.author: Jeff S.

customer_reviews.title: Almost a perfect buy for me.
customer_reviews.text: Everyone has their own opinions, but this worked for me and would be a perfect 5 except for one thing. The, for a lack of a better term, forearm brace has no give or adjustments and is tight. I would say I have about medium size forearms and on my right arm there is no room and pinches/squeezes a when using, and because of this it almost feels like my right arm work out is a little off. But other than that easy to use, no real set up and felt a good burn from it. Would be willing to spend a more if they come out with an adjustable forearm feature.
customer_reviews.author: Concerned Reader

customer_reviews.title: It’s good.....but....
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product, however I would have to agree with some of the other reviewers that you max out fairly easy on this. The difficulty only goes from 1-5 and should be 1-10. They honestly need to make a different version of this with more resistance like “Marcy wrist MAX” or something along those lines. Either that or just improve the existing one. Other than that great product. Still get a burn but not the resistance I’m looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Not 4 after surgery rehab
customer_reviews.text: If you just had surgery this is not for you. I bought this to continue physical therapy at home but you have to be careful with this one. Even on the lowest setting it's quite strong. This one is going back, was missing a hinge pin. Check the device throughly before using.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: Good for beginner. Not enough resistance.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product, but it doesn't have enough resistance. It's predecessor had a much wider resistance range. This is just too easy. Even on the hardest setting. I guess it would be okay for someone that was just starting to develop their forearm strength though.
customer_reviews.author: Big Sam!

customer_reviews.title: High reps is the key!
customer_reviews.text: If you are a person who works out regularly, you might be disappointed in the tension when it is maxed out. However, if you turn this into a high rep workout device, it is very good! Because the tension is so easy when maxed out, I do a high amount of reps for one exercise. ( i.e. 100 reps x 3 sets) The other exercise I do is a static hold for 3 minutes. I do this for 2 reps.
customer_reviews.author: JACK Dismas

customer_reviews.title: Best forearm blaster I've ever used.
customer_reviews.text: Solid product and easy to use. Lightweight and sturdy. I noticed results in less than two weeks. Easy to adjust tension control as your forearms get stronger. I take it with me everywhere I'm able to sit down and use it throughout the day.
customer_reviews.author: bobbyo

customer_reviews.title: Works well, does what it's supposed to do.
customer_reviews.text: This is sturdy enough that it should last quite a while. It has adjustable tension, and it doesn't make noise. If it made noise, then my wife would get irritated, and then she also would make noise, and then I wouldn't like this thing any more, so it's good that it does not make noise.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Coy

customer_reviews.title: tension adjustable incrementally makes this the best i have found on the market !
customer_reviews.text: I also bought the carbon fiber wrist exerciser and it good but tuff ! This marcy gives very adjustable tension and the design is perfect and so much more comfort padded in all my weak and tender areas. Great value for used / new condition price
customer_reviews.author: mark s.

customer_reviews.title: Great forearm workout
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I didn't give Ease of Use five stars is because of the location of the hand grip, it's easier to get your hand into than out of. Seems like it'd be just pull it out the opposite of how you put it in. But it's not. Other than that, it's great!
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Bridges

customer_reviews.title: Adjustment is ??? this is why no 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect tool, but where's the adjustment.. you can crank it up and down all the way without feeling much difference.. But the unit works well, and you will feel the burn after 20 reps
customer_reviews.author: DrDJin

customer_reviews.title: Great forearm workout
customer_reviews.text: Used this when I was younger and loved it. Great not to have to get big weights out when this is more handy to have. If it’s not enough weight just do more. Then more again and again.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Simply an ok device
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't provide nearly enough resistance to be considered use for exercise. It is easy to use and the range of motion is great. It isn't cheaply either. If the manufacturer could create an enhanced version with greater resistance I would give it a definite recommendation.
customer_reviews.author: Kiara5000

customer_reviews.title: Used after Tennis Elbow surgery !!
customer_reviews.text: Love this, bought it after tennis elbow surgery and it worked great for reconditioning the forearm. It was great for strength training and rehab of the elbow. Would recommend it. Still using it for forearm training. Awesome product 😁
customer_reviews.author: Robert B.

customer_reviews.title: Really good, wish resistance could go higher
customer_reviews.text: The only drawback to these is that even at the highest resistance, they can still be easy for those with stronger forearms. I use these to supplement rather than replace what I do at the gym.
customer_reviews.author: Mike McG

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Very well built, nice design, and performs excellent this machine will really develop the front and back of your forearm. My forearms look bigger and more vascular after just one month.
customer_reviews.author: Sammy

customer_reviews.title: Looks good.  Just be cautious of forearm circumference.
customer_reviews.text: This unit is designed to build forearms and strengthen wrists. I have a small fitment problem as my forearm barely fits within the brace. Bought it to strengthen my wrists. It seems sturdy. Time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Panwolf

customer_reviews.title: doesn't fit all hands
customer_reviews.text: doesn't adjust enough and is narrow at grip, rubs thumbs raw
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price
customer_reviews.text: Only goes to 5 lbs it would be better if is was 10 to 15 lbs
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great workout but...
customer_reviews.text: It’s great for working out and making yours forearm muscles grow, but the part that rests on my arm near where my elbow joint bends broke some of my blood vessels because my arm was too short and there was a lot of pressure applied when I used it.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna

customer_reviews.title: Happy so far
customer_reviews.text: I've had it a few weeks. It works very well for both directions. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because the foam pad could be more comfortable. But mechanically it works very well. I wanted to simply get a lot more time working my forearms since it's a body part you can work much more often than hitting forearms on a 3 day split. The adjuster works well, and it feels like a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Decent idea
customer_reviews.text: Neat little contraption. Works well. Has a tension adjust but mines either broke or it’s just for decoration. Overall I like it just wish it function properly
customer_reviews.author: Tommy tee

customer_reviews.title: Does its job pretty well
customer_reviews.text: Disregarding your goal, I'd recommend this nonetheless -- it is sturdy, effective, and simple to use to get a crazy pump going for your forearms, stretch your muscles, and rehab fragile wrists.
customer_reviews.author: Super Ultimate Mega Fire

customer_reviews.title: great forearm burn
customer_reviews.text: Some people complain this is too easy even on the highest setting. At the end of your forearm / grip strength day, do 100 with each hand and your forearms will be burning. Stimulates great blood flow. One of the few novelty pieces of exercise equipment that actually works.
customer_reviews.author: Indrid Cold

customer_reviews.title: Highly effective for rehab
customer_reviews.text: My OT had me use this as part of my rehab This tool is helping me regain strength in my wrist and forearms I highly recommend it
customer_reviews.author: J. Carr

customer_reviews.title: I'm not sure anyone's going to develop these massive forearms with it but it's better than nothing and it seems to have helped with ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well. I'm not sure anyone's going to develop these massive forearms with it but it's better than nothing and it seems to have helped with pain in my left wrist. Slight injury or arthritis I guess but it did help.
customer_reviews.author: James J. Emerson

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made and it clicks when using it like plastic is rubbing against a spring.
customer_reviews.text: It does give a workout to your forearm, but it feels cheaply made and sounds cheaply made, making you feel like it will break.
customer_reviews.author: mwhite

customer_reviews.title: Need more resistants
customer_reviews.text: Enorder to get a full range of motion you HV to take your free hand and put it between your working forearm and the pad. Also 5 degrees of difficulty is not enough. Need at least 10. I have to do 40 or 50 to reach failure. If they had a 10, I would buy 2.
customer_reviews.author: ron

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for fitness especially for forearms, arms  and grip strength
customer_reviews.text: Loved the resistance and its so much faster to get into for great forearm and hand strength workouts. I would have love a lil more levels for longer range of resistance curls. But it's a nearly perfect device.I will always use this marcy product for my weight and martial arts workouts for arms. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: shell540z

customer_reviews.title: Well built
customer_reviews.text: Really nice quality. I can't believe it's only $20. Really good plastics, easy to adjust and use. Not flimsy whatsoever. Well done.
customer_reviews.author: Gravesnear

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Good product. I put it next to my computer and use it regularly. I am training for sports and found someone suggested this. I have used it for a while, feels good so far.
customer_reviews.author: Lux C. Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Well made works good
customer_reviews.text: Good product for the price. I just wish it had more resistance.
customer_reviews.author: Jp

customer_reviews.title: Helped with a wrist injury.
customer_reviews.text: Worked for me, can’t say if it will work for you. I recommend it and now I can work out at full tension resistant.
customer_reviews.author: DaBradleys

customer_reviews.title: Useless to me
customer_reviews.text: Product is cheaply made, you cannot make it harder, just stopped being able to make it more of a workout.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Amado

customer_reviews.title: Tension is fine
customer_reviews.text: I'm happy with this purchase. There's enough tension for me. You can turn it backwards and work your fore arm as well.
customer_reviews.author: MarkMak

customer_reviews.title: I like it!!
customer_reviews.text: I like it. I can work out my forearms while chilling and watch tv. Just put your arm in there and start curling. Lazy way to exercise your forearms. Lol
customer_reviews.author: Pleasant1911

customer_reviews.title: works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: great forearm and wrist developer. Have been using for several years now. Still works like new
customer_reviews.author: Terry Allen

customer_reviews.title: Way too easy for an adult male
customer_reviews.text: Beware, Very little resistance! Way too easy for an adult male. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Mcockener

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use, and gets great results! Hopefully they’ll make more simple products like these!
customer_reviews.author: JustMyTake

customer_reviews.title: good design, sturdy construction
customer_reviews.text: I was very pleased with this device. It is sturdy, and looks like it should last forever, since it is constructed of solid plastic, with some metal parts. I was looking for a way to build up my wrists after an accident, and this was much better than other devices I tried. The device gives my wrists and forearms an excellent workout. The tension can be adjusted. My only complaint is it is a little to big for my arms. I find that I have to hold the frame of the device with my free hand otherwise it bites into my arm, but overall I am very happy with this device. It might not be comfortable for a child.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Ginensky

customer_reviews.title: The missing piece to any great arm workout.
customer_reviews.text: This is an essential piece of equipment for anybody looking to add that missing ingredient to their arm workout.
customer_reviews.author: Odinson

customer_reviews.title: Wish it went to 10
customer_reviews.text: I like this. But other reviews were correct, i wish the resistance went to ten. I easily can do the max setting. But that just means i do alot of reps.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I typically use this while sitting at the desk. Love the adjustable tension however it could use a little more comfort around the forearm
customer_reviews.author: Justin Wood

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Good quality and very sturdy. Feels like a good workout for the forearms and wrists. Easier than set up the curl bar.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I love this wrist trainer now I have one for each arm it works great and it looks super great
customer_reviews.author: walterbeatty

customer_reviews.title: Great for wrist pain!
customer_reviews.text: I had inflammation in my wrist for very long time , constant pain. This forearm exercise tool really helps. The pain has subsided. I am really happy with it. I suffer with pain in for 5 years and in a couple of weeks I experienced great improvement.
customer_reviews.author: Ottar Olivera

customer_reviews.title: Its ok.
customer_reviews.text: It works but seems like it doesn't pull/push on my arm just right. I feel like it might do more harm then good, It's probably me not using it correctly or something.
customer_reviews.author: Donald E. Dyer

customer_reviews.title: Not strong enough.
customer_reviews.text: This might be good for rehab. Used on max can barely feel the pump in my forearms
customer_reviews.author: John Smith

customer_reviews.title: I recommend.
customer_reviews.text: As a guy who isn't a bodybuilder, it gives me a good workout in quick time.
customer_reviews.author: MARK C. ALIRE

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for me!
customer_reviews.text: I can definitely feel it working the forearms, I got it to help tennis elbow and wrist pain. Both are gone.
customer_reviews.author: S. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Need to add resistance separately
customer_reviews.text: Not very good for forearm development at all, BUT I bought rubber straps to give it heavy resistance and the results are great.
customer_reviews.author: christopher vera

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Good machine. Wish it had a little more padding for my skinny arms
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to help with my husband physical training after a wrist surgery. Great product
customer_reviews.author: Desiree Neely

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works good for wrist and fore arm workout for the materials. Time will tell on how it holds up.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy S

customer_reviews.title: This item is great for the time waiting for callers to troubleshoot
customer_reviews.text: I work technical support in a call center. This item is great for the time waiting for callers to troubleshoot. I've had this thing for just over a month, I'm getting really good definition and strength in my forearms. It could use more tension though. or a way to upgrade the tension.
customer_reviews.author: The Norm

customer_reviews.title: It really works
customer_reviews.text: It works my weak side, so that now I can carry things with both hands now
customer_reviews.author: Sammy b

customer_reviews.title: Wrist forearm developer
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these before, works great. Good price!
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: I will always have one of these
customer_reviews.text: For anyone who wants good grip strength or is even recovering from carpal tunnel or broken wrist, these things are AWESOME. There is nothing like it anywhere. Its true the older one seemed more substantial but it also was clunky. It lasted for years and when it broke, I replaced it with the new plastic one. It works fine, just a little different. Try and exercise your wrists back and forth between arms for awhile curling your wrist and reversing it also. See how long you can take the burn. These work just fine !
customer_reviews.author: Papa Rox

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: this is a well made machine and U can see a lot of thought went into the design quality of materials for n inexpensive price
customer_reviews.author: roy suarez

customer_reviews.title: Great workout
customer_reviews.text: it has different levels for strength building, i broke my wrist years ago, and this is helping get my power in my hand back.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Castro

customer_reviews.title: Fun idea
customer_reviews.text: You don’t need to know why I need this thing honey.
customer_reviews.author: RJB

customer_reviews.title: Works great but needs more resistance
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Doesn’t work the greatest for lifters that are use to working forearms with a lot more weight than what this allows but overall the product works great with its fit and feel and overall performance. Higher resistance is it’s only downfall.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: This was an awesome product, however, it was not the right fit for me.
customer_reviews.author: Marcia Bolden

customer_reviews.title: Great for forearm strength training
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product especially for a muscle group that is hard to find exercises for. I’ve been using this for about a month now and seeing a noticeable difference in my forearm strength and muscle tone. I highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Ant S

customer_reviews.title: Great forearm workout !
customer_reviews.text: Great product theology classics never die. I agree with other reviews the forearm pad could be a little softer.
customer_reviews.author: John T

customer_reviews.title: Great Product so far!
customer_reviews.text: The resistance seems good. We'll see if this technology really works in a few months from now.
customer_reviews.author: New_Manone

customer_reviews.title: Does what it should
customer_reviews.text: Great product, only down side is it makes noise after you really start to use it, totally recommend and I still use it today
customer_reviews.author: joe

customer_reviews.title: Great for starters/beginners
customer_reviews.text: The product is made in Taiwan. It is great tool for starters and beginners who live in a small living areas without space to put a largr set of exercising tools.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Love this. Well made & adjustable. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome. I like this device. Works very well. Adjustable resistance. Excellent forearm workout. While watching tv or driving or between sets at the gym. Great addition to my arm program.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: 5 star
customer_reviews.text: Husband bought this to strengthen arm , while healing from hand surgery. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for tfcc tear
customer_reviews.text: Injured my tfcc playing golf, and it was taking forever to heal (5+ weeks)...using this item it really helped get rid of the pinching pain, presumably by strengthening the surrounding supporting muscles. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Hwa

customer_reviews.title: I like this a lot
customer_reviews.text: I like this a lot. Works great for working out the forearm and I keep it at the office along with one of the hand-squeeze grips. I love that the resistance is adjustable. It has definitely been getting my forearms toned.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Chichester

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product!! It does a good job of working the muscles in the forearm!! Fast service too!!
customer_reviews.author: David Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for arm wrestling training.
customer_reviews.text: Great wrist workout. I use this to help with arm wrestling.
customer_reviews.author: Jason K

customer_reviews.title: It's okay.
customer_reviews.text: It's okay. Had a gold's gym one that had a hell of a lot more resistance. This will work great for people not trying to build lots of muscle. Maybe people recovering from an injury.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product. We absolutely love it! Highly recommend it. I own a lot of work out equipment and this is one of the best exercise machines I have ever bought. Simple to use, well built, effective, affordable
customer_reviews.author: Leila M.

customer_reviews.title: Hard but get easier. Great for stroke patients
customer_reviews.text: Was hard at first. Got easier in a few days
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: This is a good device in working the wrist and forearm tendons
customer_reviews.text: This is a good device in working the wrist and forearm tendons. If turned around backwards it actually works the wrist in a different direction. I like this product need to do a lot of reps but it will give you a good burn in your arm. I do believe it has helped strengthen my wrist and forearm. The only reason I didn't give it a five star is the fact it needs to have a stronger tension when maxed out.Overall a good training tool.
customer_reviews.author: Randall Tinsley

customer_reviews.title: Crushing it
customer_reviews.text: Used to have this as the Nolan Ryan pitching trainer. Perfect for building grip and forearm strength
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: Newer model is better built than the original.
customer_reviews.text: Maximum tension is not as strong as my original Marcy wedge of 20 year's ago.But this newer model is better built than the original.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Pretlow

product_meta.title: Marcy Wrist and Forearm Developer/Strengthener Home Gym Gear - Wedge
product_meta.description:
Get bigger and bulkier arm with the Marcy Wrist and Forearm Developer! Created to let you achieve a toned and better-looking physique, this exercise tool specifically targets the flexor and extensor muscles to give you buff arms! Build your strength day to day to improve your catching ability, your stick-handling in hockey, and your ball control in basketball with this fitness gear. 

 Perfect for fitness amateurs and gym buffs alike, this workout gear lets you perform a wide variety of exercises that will tone and develop your forearms. This innovative gym gear strengthens the forearms, wrists, and fingers to increase your grip strength. 

 This forearm and wrist exerciser is made of premium steel that’s guaranteed to resist damage and corrosion from sweat, humidity, and other environmental factors. Additionally, this workout accessory features a variable resistance system that allows you to track your progresses. It works by increasing the resistance toward to concentric phase of the lift, letting you experience greater tension in your muscles and gain better results from the exercise. Designed to accommodate every hand and arm shape, this exercise tool also has adjustable bars, allowing you to create the perfect and most comfortable fit for your forearms. The panel ensures precise targeting of the arm muscles, guaranteeing that each area’s specific muscle group receives enough tension to facilitate growth and development.

 The Marcy WEDGE measures 14.5 x 8 x 6. Its compact structure allows you to easily and conveniently store it at home without taking up too much space. 

 Whether it’s for your home gym or for professional use, the Marcy wrist and forearm strengthener will kick your fitness routine up a notch! Flex your way to more muscular arms with this premium fitness gear from Marcy. 



AMAZON.COM
Terminate weakness in your forearms, fingers, and wrists with the cyborg-like Powerhouse Wedge. The unique, smooth resistance system builds the flexor and extensor muscles while enhancing your grip strength. The mechanism supports your forearm and wrist for maximum safety and comfort, while a variable resistance system allows you to measure your progress. The grip is also adjustable to suit a wide variety of hand and arm shapes.

 What's in the Box?
Powerhouse Wedge exercise unit, user's manual, warranty

 Manufacturer Warranty
2 years
feature_bullets: TARGETS THE FOREARMS, WRISTS, & FINGERS– Develop your forearms and wrists with this exercise equipment that’s designed to target the flexor and extensor muscles in your arms. This gym equipment also strengthens the fingers to increase your grip strength

ADJUSTABLE GRIP – Designed for adjustable grip allowing you to create the perfect fit for your forearms, the grip ensures precise targeting of the muscles in your arms, guaranteeing each muscle group receives enough tension to facilitate development.

PORTABLE - This ingenious strengthener measures 14.5 inches in length, 8 inches in width, and 6 inches in height. Its compact structure allows you to easily and conveniently store it at home without taking up too much space.

VARIABLE RESISTANCE SYSTEM- This workout gear comes with a variable resistance system that monitors your progress by increasing the resistance toward the concentric phase of the lift, facilitating efficient performance of various arm exercises.

COMES WITH 2- YEAR WARRANTY – The Marcy Wrist and Forearm Developer gives you the best value for your money. This exercise tool comes with a two year warranty to let your maximize your purchases and enjoy hassle-free use for a long time.
